segments.advisor_message: So, think of investing like climbing a mountain. The higher you go, the better the view, but it also becomes riskier, right? You need to assess how comfortable you are with heights before you commit to that climb.
segments.client_message: I get that, but... what do you mean by risk? Like, how do I know when it's too risky for me?

segments.advisor_message: Exactly! Risk is essentially the chance you take—just like a mountain climber faces the risk of falling or encountering bad weather. You can plan, but you still need to be cautious and prepared.
segments.client_message: Hmm, okay, but isn't all investing a little risky? I just want to make sure I don't fall off the edge, if you know what I mean.

segments.advisor_message: Absolutely, and that brings me to the point about diversifying. Just like a climber uses ropes and gear, diversifying your investments can help reduce that risk. It's about spreading out so that you don’t have all your eggs in one basket.
segments.client_message: Got it! So maybe... I should look into different kinds of investments then. Just to play it safe?
